data.title: Map of Polish Composers
data.meta_description: At the beginning of his career an examining magistrate and member of the Young Poland movement, after a depression during the war Apolinary Szeluto implemented Socialist Realism. Szeluto was born in St. Petersburg and fascinated with Scriabin, but studied in Warsaw and developed a Neo-Romantic national style, composing numerous polonaises, mazurkas and dances. He also wrote numerous (unpublished and unperformed) operas and symphonies, as well as songs for the masses.
